    • How to use shapper for regression

    How to use shapper for regression

    Alicja Gosiewska

    2019-01-04

    shapper_regression.Rmd

    Introduction

    The shapper is an R package which ports the shap python library in R. For details and examples see shapper repository on github and shapper website.

    SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) is a method to explain predictions of any machine learning model. For more details about this method see shap repository on github.

    Install shaper and shap

    R package shapper

    devtools::install_github("ModelOriented/shapper")

    Python library shap

    To run shapper python library shap is required. It can be installed both by python or R. To install it throught R, you an use function install_shap from the shapper package.

    shapper::install_shap()

    Load data sets

    The example usage is presented on the HR dataset from the R package DALEX2. For more details see DALEX2 github repository.

    # devtools::install_github("ModelOriented/DALEX2")
library("DALEX2")
Y_train <- dragons$life_length
x_train <- dragons[ , -8]

    Let’s build model

    library(randomForest)
set.seed(123)
model_rf <- randomForest(x = x_train, y = Y_train)

    Here shapper starts

    First step is to create an explainer for each model. The explainer is an object that wraps up a model and meta-data.

    library(shapper)

ive_rf <- individual_variable_effect(model_rf, data = x_train,
                                     new_observation = x_train[1,])
    ive_rf
    ##     year_of_birth   height   weight scars colour year_of_discovery
## 1           -1291 59.40365 15.32391     7    red              1700
## 1.1         -1291 59.40365 15.32391     7    red              1700
## 1.2         -1291 59.40365 15.32391     7    red              1700
## 1.3         -1291 59.40365 15.32391     7    red              1700
## 1.4         -1291 59.40365 15.32391     7    red              1700
## 1.5         -1291 59.40365 15.32391     7    red              1700
##     number_of_lost_teeth _id_ _ylevel_   _yhat_ _yhat_mean_
## 1                     25    1          1378.918    1370.243
## 1.1                   25    1          1378.918    1370.243
## 1.2                   25    1          1378.918    1370.243
## 1.3                   25    1          1378.918    1370.243

## 1.1            height    -2.4789760      - randomForest
## 1.2            weight    -0.4807110      - randomForest
## 1.3             scars  -126.0033746      - randomForest
## 1.4            colour     0.2723997      + randomForest
## 1.5 year_of_discovery     8.8447529      + randomForest

    Plotting results

    plot(ive_rf)
